channel.title: Comparative & International on Maurits van der Veen
channel.description: Recent content in Comparative & International on Maurits van der Veen

item.title: Politics of European Cooperation
item.description: Overview (from the introductory section of the 2020 syllabus) The 2016 Brexit referendum in the United Kingdom highlighted many of questions still confounding observers of European integration even after more than 60 years of development. Does disaster threaten the EU from all sides, while a glorious future awaits those who abandon ship? Or does does leaving the EU doom a country to a painful economic and political hangover?

item.title: Human Rights and Humanitarianism
item.description: Overview (from the introductory section of the 2019 syllabus) What are human rights, where do they come from, and why do/should they matter? Recent events around the world underscore the importance of grappling with such questions, as they relate to a wide range of issues, from the ongoing Syrian crisis (What rights do/should refugees have? How do/should we respond to crimes against humanity committed by a government?
